race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap

runners.name: Saratoga Gold
runners.comment: Seemed to stay this trip when fifth at Chester last time; respected back on AW
runners.spotlight: 8-47, with the latest of those wins coming in July 2023; beaten a length when third of ten at Newbury (1m4f, good to firm; first-time visor) last month and seemed to stay this trip well enough when fifth of 12 at Chester (2m, good) 18 days ago; unexposed over this far and he's respected returned to AW.

quotes.race: Rangers Riding Ranch Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought as a youngster Saratoga Gold wanted softer ground, being by Mayson, but he seems to like it quick and Kayleigh gave him a cool ride. We had another in here but she said she wanted to ride him so credit to her - Charles Hills, trainer.

The ground was the only question mark for Saratoga Gold, but they've done a wonderful job here. Kieran came in and said he'd stay two miles, but he does travel well. There are no plans yet, but he could improve again, especially over further and if he gets his toe in - Charlie Hills, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was gelded before the start of last season and the results were impressive with four wins, including a hat-trick in the late summer months, all over 1m4f, with two at Epsom. He really thrives on those undulating tracks, as the first of his wins last year was at Goodwood. He has had one run this season when a decent third at Newmarket last month over 1m6f, his first try at the trip. There are plenty of options coming up for him and he seems in good order. 21-06-23

runners.name: Cracker Star
runners.comment: Sole win came last June; struggled in three outings since joining this stable; up to 2m
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 14 starts came at Bath (1m4f, good to firm) last June on his final start for Richard Hughes; failed to make an impact in four starts over hurdles for Harry Derham and he's struggled in three outings since joining this stable; tries this trip on the Flat for the first time.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who does everything nicely and is about a month off making his debut. I would be looking to start him off over a mile but he is another who will be better next year. He certainly catches the eye. 29-06-23

runners.name: Navid
runners.comment: Made all at Salisbury in July (1m6f); has to bounce back from Chester; blinkers now added
runners.spotlight: Can front run; made all at Salisbury (1m6f, good to firm; flag start) in July before another good effort when second of four at Ffos Las (2m, good); needs to bounce back from a lesser effort at Chester (1m6f, good) 18 days ago; blinkers applied.

runners.name: Khangai
runners.comment: Off since finishing second at Doncaster 82 days ago; returns to AW with stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Won by a head at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm) in June on his second start for this stable before another good effort when second of eight at Doncaster (1m6f, good) 82 days ago; off since and returns to AW with his stamina to prove for the longer trip.

runners.name: Billy Bathgate
runners.comment: C&D winner in May; placed in each of his last three starts and holds claims returned to 2m
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in May and also won at Redcar (1m6f, good to firm) in June; well beaten on his next start but he's been placed in each of his three outings since (1m5f/1m6f); steps back up in trip and returns to AW with claims.

race_name: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 519 Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Challenge Anneka
runners.comment: Down the field on debut at Yarmouth last August; off since; switches to AW on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 6f AW winner Wren Officer (RPR 79); down the field on debut at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm; 50-1) last August when trained by James Horton; off since and now switches to AW on his stable debut; watch the betting.

runners.name: Eliza Bennet
runners.comment: 0-8; beaten in a match race at Kempton last time and now drops back to 6f; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; runner-up in a handicap at Kempton (7f, AW) in June and ran to a similar level when beaten in a match race over that same C&D 27 days ago; drops to 6f for the first time since her debut with tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Encore
runners.comment: Half-sister to Lope Y Fernandez; fifth on debut at Kempton 15 days ago; should improve
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to six winners including Lope Y Fernandez (6f-1m including 2yo Group 3; RPR 118); showed ability when fifth of nine on debut at Kempton (6f, AW; 17-2) 15 days ago; may well take a step forward.

runners.name: Hello Goodbye
runners.comment: Runner-up here over 7f on debut and at Southwell last time; drops to 6f with the visor on
runners.spotlight: Runner-up here on debut (7f) and at Southwell (7f, AW) 26 days ago either side of finishing fifth at Yarmouth (1m, good; flashed her tail); now drops to 6f with the visor applied.

runners.name: Polka
runners.comment: Closely related to winners First Of May (6f AW including 2yo; RPR 85); hooded on her debut
runners.spotlight: By Territories; third foal; closely related to winners First Of May (6f AW including 2yo; RPR 85) and Zachary (5f/6f AW 2yo; 61); dam sprint maiden (55), out of five-time 1m Group 1 winner Soviet Song; hooded for her debut.

race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Golden Conqueror
runners.comment: 16-1 at Kempton (7f) when interfered with early before seeing his race out well
runners.spotlight: 200,000gns breeze-up purchase; 16-1 for debut at Kempton (7f) recently where he was interfered with early on but saw his race out quite takingly; respected.

runners.name: Harswell Angel
runners.comment: Made little impression over C&D only five days ago when an 80-1 chance
runners.spotlight: Made little impression over C&D only five days ago when an 80-1 chance.

runners.name: Mr Wonka
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Ecurie Melanie &
runners.comment: Encouraging Sandown debut but failed to give his true running at Doncaster since
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros yearling; finished fourth of ten at Sandown (7f, soft) last month in a race that's working out but he didn't give his true running at Doncaster (1m, soft) since; remains of interest.

runners.name: Skiathos
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt who's a brother to 5f/6f 2yo winner Attagirl (Listed; RPR 98)
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt who's a brother to 5f/6f 2yo winner Attagirl (Listed; RPR 98); dam Listed-class Italian 5f-6f 2yo winner; he wouldn't need to be super special to win this.

runners.name: Tarmonbarry Kid
runners.comment: Wasn't far away when fifth of eight at Chester and that place is never easy for a newcomer
runners.spotlight: Not that far away when fifth of eight at Chester (7f, good) on debut in July and that place is never easy for a newcomer; should improve.

runners.name: Wardlaw
runners.comment: 200-1 when trailing home last over 7f at Kempton 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: 200-1 when trailing home last over 7f on Kempton AW 12 days ago.

runners.name: Stockpyle
runners.comment: Mostly struggled since finishing runner-up at Doncaster in March and now drops in grade
runners.spotlight: Has won four times from 7f-1m (AW/turf); runner-up at Doncaster (7f, good; first-time tongue-tie) in March off a mark 10lb higher than today but he's mostly struggled since; returns to 1m and drops in grade with the cheekpieces back on and tongue-tie removed.

quotes.race: Plan A Consulting Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were going to sell Stockpyle at the July sales, but PJ [McDonald, jockey] said something was troubling him. We took him to the vets and checked him, where we found a huge growth under his epiglottis. It was like having a cork in a bottle and he couldn't breathe, but now his confidence is being rewarded. He's been running some lovely races and has been unlucky not to win more. He's from a very good family and there's more excitement to come - William Muir, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another of La Pyle's progeny who is a half-brother to Pyledriver, he did his owners proud this summer by winning twice in four days at Chepstow and Wolverhampton, both over 7f. I love him and having had a tiny injury as a juvenile - a split pastern that healed beautifully - he has made steady progress. He was last of six at Chepstow on Monday but must have the ground just right and when things go his way he looks pretty impressive. Clearly 7f is his trip and there are more wins to come this year. 01-09-22

runners.name: Travis
runners.comment: Below his best at Thirsk last time but soft ground may have been to blame; may bounce back
runners.spotlight: 2-26; lost out by a nose at Ripon (1m, good to firm) last month and soft ground may have been to blame for a below-par effort at Thirsk (7f) 15 days ago; 0-5 on AW but may bounce back.

runners.name: Barleybrown
runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner; shaped as if in form when hampered at Southwell last time
runners.spotlight: Four of his five wins have been over this C&D, with the most recent coming last October; never landed a blow but shaped as if in form when seventh at Southwell (1m, AW; hampered) 36 days ago; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: Last year was a good one for him with four wins, all at Newcastle over a mile. He had a busy time of it and has had aeak since December. He'll need to improve a bit this year because he's risen to a mark of 66. He needs to be held up. 09-04-25

runners.name: Mercurius Power
runners.comment: 3lb lower than when beaten a head at Southwell in January but needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner (7f/1m); beaten a head at Southwell (1m, AW) in January off a 3lb higher mark than today but he needs to bounce back from a lesser effort at Wolverhampton 24 days ago.

runners.name: Tees George
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd And David Buist
runners.comment: Bounced back from a below-par effort when second of 11 over C&D last time; holds claims
runners.spotlight: Course winner over 7f in September 2023 and he bounced back from a below-par effort when second of 11 over this C&D 11 days ago; again holds claims.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse who hasn't run a bad race all year. He's no superstar but at his level he's very consistent. The only issue I have with him is he's a massive horse who's vlight-framed and it's hard to keep condition on him. His last two runs have been very good and he'll be winning sooner rather than later. 26-07-24

runners.name: Misemerald
runners.comment: Made late progress into third at Musselburgh last time; back up to 1m for her AW debut
runners.spotlight: All 22 starts on turf; made late progress into third at Musselburgh (7f, good to soft) 16 days ago, shaping as if the return to this trip would suit; not ruled out.

runners.name: Liberty Flame
runners.comment: 0-13; hard to recommend on recent handicap runs and others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-13 (bumpers/hurdles/Flat); hard to recommend on recent efforts in handicaps and others are preferred.

runners.name: Second Fiddle
runners.comment: Landed a gamble on soft ground at Hamilton on stable debut; escapes a penalty; back on AW
runners.spotlight: 0-14 in Ireland but landed a gamble at Hamilton (8.5f, soft) eight days ago on her first start for this stable; escapes a penalty for that success and holds strong claims if handling the switch back to AW (first attempt in a qualifying run; dam won twice on sand, including Tapeta).

quotes.race: DX Academy Industry Expertise For You Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: The owner pointed out the support for Second Fiddle just before the off but the horses don't know what prices they are. We've not had her long. I have a friend in Ireland who sourced Gemini Man, and we were getting concerned as we were light for horses for the all-weather. I got two sprinters, one of them Little Mi Mi, who ran well at Newcastle last Friday. They'd been working together, so I thought she had to run well. Christy [Donoghue, former trainer] pointed out that they had a virus in the yard last year, so we knew we could get a bit more out of them. Mohammed [Tabti, jockey] had ridden her a lot at home, and he knew she would favour that ground - Val Renwick, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Dingwall
runners.comment: Sole win came at Ayr last July; down the field here over 1m last time; back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Sole win came at Ayr (1m2f, good; first-time hood) last July; struggled in recent starts and was well beaten here over 1m 22 days ago; steps back up in distance.

stable_tour.quote: His work has always been very good at home and we've found the key to him after running him over the wrong trip to begin with. He never got involved first time this year over 7f and we tried a mile at Hamilton but he ran far too free in blinkers, so we put a hood on over 1m2f at Ayr and it worked a treat. I couldn't believe he'd slipped down to a mark of 56 as he's a lovely horse and I hope he'll be on an upward curve now. There are plenty of opportunities for him. 26-07-24

runners.name: Come On John
runners.comment: Beaten 24l when last of ten at Hamilton (1m5f) last time; back on AW and down in trip
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner; ran okay when fifth of 12 over this C&D in June but he failed to beat a rival home at Hamilton (1m5f, good; beaten 24l) 75 days ago; switches back to AW and drops in trip having been off since.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely little horse. He won for us at Southwell in October but has been a little bit unlucky as has been second three times in a row now. He runs at Newcastle on Thursday. 01-01-25

runners.name: Timetobenice
runners.comment: 1-19; down the field in all four starts for this yard; steps back up in distance
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 19 starts came in a maiden at Kempton (1m, AW) in November 2023 when trained by Marco Botti; down the field in all four starts for this stable, including here over 1m last time (first-time blinkers); back up in trip in a switch of headgear.

runners.name: Muhib
runners.comment: Fourth over this C&D in March off an 11lb higher mark; struggling on turf when last seen
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who failed to beat a rival home in either of his two outings in July, but he was fourth over this C&D in March off a mark 11lb higher than today; cheekpieces removed on his first start for 64 days.

runners.name: The Pug
runners.comment: Won a classified event at Ffos Las on his final start for Adrian Wintle; makes yard debut
runners.spotlight: Landed a classified event at Ffos Las (1m2f, good) 39 days ago on his final start for Adrian Wintle; now switches from grass (3-24 on AW) and returns to handicap company on his yard debut.

quotes.quote: I'm thrilled for the owners as they've been good supporters. However frustrating The Pug has been, he's won well and Finley [Marsh] has given him a fantastic ride. He has more ability than he shows on the track but he is ultra consistent. He's just difficult to win with but this was the right race - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

runners.name: Hashtagnotions
runners.comment: Won two of his three starts since cheekpieces went on; up 3lb and steps up in distance
runners.spotlight: Has responded well to the application of cheekpieces, winning a classified at Ayr (1m, good) and a handicap at Beverley (8.5f, soft) 13 days ago; up 3lb and switches back to AW (dual course winner over 1m) on his first try over this far.

runners.name: Ballitore
runners.comment: 0-7; 12l behind Hashtagnotions when down the field at Beverley last time; up in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-7; fifth of eight at Hamilton (8.5f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) earlier in the month but he was 12l behind Hashtagnotions at Beverley (8.5f, soft) 13 days ago; steps up in trip (out of a French 1m2f winner) on this return to AW.

runners.name: Heartened
runners.comment: Off the mark in a C&D handicap last time; respected following a 2lb rise in the weights
runners.spotlight: Third in a classified event at Ripon (1m2f, good) last month before getting off the mark in a handicap over this C&D 11 days ago; respected following a 2lb rise.

runners.name: Cookie Queen
runners.comment: Beaten 27l at Beverley (1m4f) in May when last seen; drops back in trip and returns to AW
runners.spotlight: Ex Tony Coyle/Kaine Wood; down the field in three AW outings earlier in the year and she was beaten 27l at Beverley (1m4f, good to firm; first-time cheekpieces) in May when last seen; drops back in trip with cheekpieces retained on this return to AW.

runners.name: Zaeim Alharb
runners.comment: Struggled in four starts (1m-1m4f) and now drops in trip with the visor on for cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Struggled in three qualifying runs (1m2f/1m) and it was the same story on handicap debut at Brighton (1m4f, soft; first-time cheekpieces) 15 days ago; drops back in trip with the visor replacing cheekpieces.

runners.name: Weegeebear

prev_owners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel O'Hare & Philip Smith

runners.comment: Runner-up at Pontefract on stable debut in July but he's struggled in three starts since
runners.spotlight: Ex Irish gelding who was second of seven at Pontefract (1m, good) on stable debut in July but he's struggled in three starts since, including when behind Hashtagnotions at Beverley (8.5f, soft) 13 days ago; back up in trip on this return to AW.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Weegeebear actually jumped slow and I went to plan B straightaway, down the rail. I was able to scoot up their inside turning the bend and got a really nice position. He travelled into the straight really well and quickened up. He's hit the line strong. He had been slowly away at Bellewstown last time. When you jump slow around Bellewstown it's hard to get into it, we struggled all the way really. I'm glad he's gone and done it today - Adam Caffrey, jockey.

runners.name: Madrigal Moment
runners.owner: Mrs P B E P Farr
runners.comment: Beaten a neck at Ripon but disappointed in a classified event at Chelmsford last time
runners.spotlight: Beaten a neck in a handicap at Ripon (1m2f, good) in July but she was disappointing in a classified event at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) 33 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Bovey Belle
runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival home in all three starts in handicap company; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who has gone off big prices and has failed to beat a rival home in all three starts in handicap company; drops in trip from 2m.

race_name: Free Race Replays On attheraces.com Handicap

runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.comment: Won in clearcut fashion on her second start for this yard; respected under a 6lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Built on her stable debut to win in clearcut fashion at Wolverhampton (7f, AW; first-time visor) eight days ago; still looks well treated under a 6lb penalty and commands plenty of respect.

runners.name: Elettaria
runners.comment: Gained her third C&D success before a solid fourth at Beverley; claims back here
runners.spotlight: Came from the back of the field to gain her third C&D success in a classified event in July, before a solid fourth of ten at Beverley (7.5f, good to firm) 48 days ago; needs things to drop right given the way she is ridden but should be competitive back here.

runners.name: Starshot
runners.comment: Sole win came over C&D in July; unfortunate not to finish a bit closer here last time
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 32nd attempt in a classified event over C&D in July and looked unfortunate not to finish a bit closer when denied at clear run here 22 days ago; each-way contender.

runners.name: Woodrafff
runners.comment: 1-11; met traffic problems before running on late for third over C&D this month
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 11 starts came at Beverley (7.5f, soft) in July; met traffic problems before running well for third over this C&D this month and again kept on late when fourth of ten at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) ten days ago; the stiffer finish back here may suit.

runners.name: My Mate Beattie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Ii And Partner
runners.comment: Well treated on her best form from last year but she's been below that level recently
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden who is well treated on her best form last year but she's been below that level in recent starts, including in first-time cheekpieces at Chelmsford 19 days ago.

runners.name: Doomsday
runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh in April but struggling for form recently; switches back to AW (0-9)
runners.spotlight: Kickstarted the season with a win at Musselburgh (7f, good) in April but he's been struggling for form in recent starts and now switches back to AW (0-9) on his first start for two months.

runners.name: Sold Out
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten in three novice/maiden events; better needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten in three novice/maiden events (7f-1m); better needed on his handicap debut.

runners.name: Oilisa
runners.comment: Shaped well in two turf handicaps (7f/1m); holds obvious claims if coping with the AW
runners.spotlight: Bettered her three previous efforts when fourth at Catterick (7f, good) on her handicap debut, doing best of those held up, and again shaped well when third of 12 at Beverley (8.5f, soft) 13 days ago; drop back to 7f may not be ideal but she holds obvious claims if coping with the return to AW.

race_name: At The Races App Expert Tips Handicap

runners.name: The Green Man
runners.comment: On a good mark but faded into seventh on stable debut 15 days ago; may take a step forward
runners.spotlight: On a good mark but he's without a win since June 2023 and faded into seventh at Thirsk (6f, soft) on stable debut 15 days ago; switches back to AW and may take a step forward.

quotes.quote: The Green Man did that easily enough and he's in good order with himself, he hasn't moved as well as this in a long time. He's flourishing. He's a big horse and he's just fully maturing - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.name: Yazaman

prev_owners.owner: A Rhodes, M Short & E Twibell
A Rhodes, M Short & R Swift
J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: 0-13 on AW; pushed along from an early stage but finished off well when fifth at Leicester
runners.spotlight: All five of his wins have been on turf; has been finishing his races off well in recent starts, latest when fifth at Leicester (6f, good to soft) when he was being pushed along from an early stage; will need things to drop right.

quotes.quote: Yazaman ran differently to Ascot in that he jumped and travelled really well over the extra furlong, while he was a bit outpaced at Ascot. I think the winner is pretty good and we were beaten by a better horse. To give our horse some credit I don't think he saw the winner coming as he was a long way from him. He's grown up a lot since his debut and he's a grand horse, but he's an out and out two-year-old so we need to get on with him and make use of him. He didn't mind the ground today - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a lovely person, absolute class, but he's a character, shall we say. He was a really good two-year-old when he was runner-up in the Richmond Stakes for William Haggas, but maybe he overachieved at two as quite a few of them do. He was one of those where we probably bought him at the right time as his rating was down into the 60s. He was running well without doing an awful lot, but when he got down to a mark of 50 he started winning. We put a visor on and it helped a bit, but it wasn't until he got the blinkers on that things started to happen. Even the first day he won at Nottingham, I still maintain that if he hadn't got a bump near the finish, he'd have finished second; he got a bump and seemed to take off and won really well. He then went to Beverley and had a bit of a troubled passage but got to the front and was well on top at the finish. When he went to Wetherby for his third success, the ground was plenty quick enough for him and the race didn't go as smoothly as we'd have liked, but he still won, whiwas fair play to him. He's got his confidence back and remembered how to win. If he wants to win again, he's still a long way ahead of the handicapper. He's entered at Leicester on Thursday but I'd be amazed if he runs as it looks like it's going to be a dry week. 28-06-24

runners.name: Bomb Squad
runners.comment: Bounced back to form when second at Wolverhampton (7f) last time; likely to run well
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Southwell earlier in the year (6f/7f); bounced back from a lesser effort when runner-up at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) two weeks ago and looks likely to run well back at 6f.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bomb Squad is a superstar and he has been in spectacular form this year. He's run some good races over seven [furlongs] prior to this without winning so we were confident he'd get the trip and, to be fair to Cieren Fallon, he insisted we stepped him up to seven - John Mackie, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pebble Dash
runners.comment: Well beaten either side of his fourth at Wolverhampton; better needed on h'cap/yard debut
runners.spotlight: Best effort from three starts for Tom Clover when a 7l fourth of nine at Wolverhampton (6f, AW; first-time cheekpieces) but he was well beaten either side of that; better needed on yard/handicap debut.

runners.name: Pit Boss
runners.comment: Looked unlucky not to finish even closer on AW debut over this C&D five days ago
runners.spotlight: Remains winless after ten starts but he shaped well over C&D on his AW debut five days ago and looked unlucky not to finish even closer; contender.

runners.name: Invitorio
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xviii And Ruth Carr

prev_owners.owner: Grange Park Racing XVIII & OFO Partners

runners.comment: Tumbled down the weights and has been placed over C&D on his last two starts; holds claims
runners.spotlight: Tumbled down the weights this year and his last two efforts (over C&D) have been much better, finishing runner-up in the first of those then third of ten 11 days ago; unexposed for this yard and has claims.

runners.name: Golden Duke
runners.comment: 3-42; finished just behind Invitorio when fourth over C&D 11 days ago; dropped 2lb
runners.spotlight: Record is 3-42, the most recent win over two years ago; finished just behind Invitorio when fourth of ten over C&D 11 days ago; dropped 2lb.

stable_tour.quote: He's very tough but has been a bit unlucky to win only one of his last four races. He might be holding a little bit back for himself and I may put cheekpieces on him for his next start just to try to get that little bit more out of him. He runs at Newmarket on Friday, which looks like it'll suit him. 27-07-22

runners.name: Pancake
runners.comment: 0-7; made some late headway when sixth behind a couple of these over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who made some late headway when sixth (behind Invitorio and Golden Duke) over this C&D 11 days ago; could go well having been dropped another 1lb.

runners.name: Baby Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Mainly running well since winning at Redcar in June, most recently second at Carlisle
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Redcar (6f, good to firm) in June and she's mostly been running well since; pulled 4l clear of the rest when runner-up at Carlisle (6f, soft) three weeks ago and should be competitive back on AW.

stable_tour.quote: We ended up with her because we've got her full brother, Curious Rover, who we've done well with. We picked him up at the sales and got her home and got her going. She's not been the easiest - she is a bit of a madam so it took a good few runs before we got a win on the board, at Redcar in June. I think we've probably got the key to her now though, and her second on her latest start at Ayr was probably a better run than her win. We're looking forward to her next run. She's entered up at Nottingham on Friday and she might also get an entry at Redcar on Sunday and we'll see which one looks the easier. 17-07-25

runners.name: A Lady Forever
runners.comment: Won over C&D in February; makes yard debut having been off since July; back up to 6f
runners.spotlight: Returned from a long absence to win a classified over this C&D in February when trained by Roger Fell; finished third in two of her three starts for Keiran Burke; back on AW and steps back up to 6f having again switched yards again.

runners.name: Superior Council

prev_owners.owner: R Howard & M McCauley & J F Levins

runners.comment: 1-28; runner-up here over 7f in July but he's been below his best in recent starts
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 28 starts came when making all in first-time blinkers at Hamilton in June; runner-up in a classified here over 7f in July but he's been below his best in recent starts; back on AW.

race_name: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Nursery Handicap

runners.name: Smartanck
runners.comment: Penalised for last week's successful nursery debut and only had to be pushed out
runners.spotlight: Minor novice form but attracted support on last week's handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f) and only had to be pushed out to collect; was ideally placed in that race and he has a penalty here, but he's the solid option.

runners.name: Ellies De Vega
runners.comment: Enters handicaps with much to prove off what could be a harsh mark
runners.spotlight: Hasn't kicked on from a fairly promising debut here over 6f and enters handicaps with much to prove off what could be a harsh mark.

runners.name: Popty Ping
runners.comment: Ran well here in June and got behind on nursery debut at Chester
runners.spotlight: Best of her five runs was the second in a C&D maiden in June and got behind on handicap debut at Chester (7f; 11-1), which is never ideal around there.

runners.name: Moo Deng
runners.comment: 0-5 and beaten a shade under 5l in her two nurseries over 7f; down 4lb for those
runners.spotlight: 0-5 and beaten a shade under 5l in her two nurseries over 7f (in first-time cheekpieces latterly); down 4lb for those but others might be better in.

runners.name: Baldosa
runners.comment: Uncompetitive in 6f/7f novices and again on handicap debut over Beverley's extended 7f
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in 6f/7f novices and again on handicap debut over Beverley's extended 7f (12-1); has to step up.

runners.name: Sweet Girl
runners.comment: Better in final run, though still only sixth of ten and that was on soft ground over 6f
runners.spotlight: A bit better in her final run, though still only sixth of ten and that was on soft ground over 6f; would still merit attention if there's money around on handicap debut.

runners.name: Miss Boyd
runners.comment: Modest form and handicapper hasn't been overly generous with his initial assessment
runners.spotlight: Modest form thus far and handicapper hasn't been overly generous with his initial assessment; has to raise her game.

runners.name: Only Dream Big
runners.comment: Similar RPRs in 6f novices under varying conditions; now goes in blinkers
runners.spotlight: Similar RPRs in 6f novices under varying conditions; always a chance that blinkers might trigger something.

runners.name: Fanjove
runners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster
runners.comment: Things have picked up in 7f nurseries; finished well for second in the latest
runners.spotlight: Things have picked up in 7f nurseries, as was given a lot to do when fourth at Kempton and then finished well for second at Chelmsford; a high head carriage didn't go unnoticed last time but he's in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: If you're looking for one for some instant gratification, he'll probably start over 6f and be out quite soon. His sire won the Coventry in 2020 at 150-1 on just his second start. 30-04-25

runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced in his first two nurseries before a quiet run on soft ground
runners.spotlight: The most experienced of these after six runs and wasn't disgraced in his first two nurseries before a quiet run on soft ground; Oisin Orr presumably had the pick of the Fahey pair.

runners.name: Hear The Drums
runners.comment: Comfortably held in 6f/7f races and on what he's shown this mark is not generous
runners.spotlight: Comfortably held in 6f/7f races and on what he's shown this mark is not generous; would need to see some confidence behind him.

runners.name: Thanos
runners.comment: Offered little in a trio of 6f novices but he's bred to be better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Another runner who offered little in novices (confined to 6f) but he's in good hands and is bred to be better than this mark; market support would heighten interest.

runners.name: Aly Louise
runners.comment: Pretty much tailed off in novices over 7f/1m and surprising should she raise her profile
runners.spotlight: Pretty much tailed off in novices over 7f/1m and surprising should she raise her profile on nursery debut.
